question: 画像
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>drawing</kanji> of an <kanji>image</kanji> is an <vocabulary>image</vocabulary>. Back in the day images were usually drawn. This is also <vocabulary>portrait</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>picture</vocabulary>, too.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
